subject: Re: [junit] Re: Testing accessors...
msgSnippet: ... Yes, we can put whatever we want in the FAQ.  This definitely deserves a spot in the FAQ. Anyone want to propose a catchy question that fits this answer?
messageBody:
David Stagner wrote:

>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>>>Personally, I tend not to test simple getters and
>>>setters. I may, however, after an incident a few
>>>weeks ago (which caused my partner and I to waste a
>>>good 45 minutes), test any constructors that set
>>>member variables, even if they look simple.
>>>
>>That's the way testing goes:
>>
>>becomeTimidAndTestEverything
>>while writingTheSameThingOverAndOverAgain
>> becomeMoreAggressive
>> writeFewerTests
>> writeTestsForMoreInterestingCases
>> if getBurnedByStupidDefect
>> feelStupid
>> becomeTimidAndTestEverything
>> end
>>end
>>
>>The loop, as you can see, never terminates.
>>
>
>
>Can we put exactly THAT in the FAQ?
>

Yes, we can put whatever we want in the FAQ. This definitely deserves a
spot in the FAQ.

Anyone want to propose a catchy question that fits this answer?

Mike


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
